content.text: Complete the statements about the pie chart
The sector angle for Mexico is ............................................ degrees
The most popular destination is
\(\frac{1}{5}\) of the people chose
180 people chose Bali
Find how many people were asked altogether
Some people each recorded their favourite holiday destination
The results are shown in the pie chart
The cost of each adult ticket is \$450
The cost of each child ticket is \(70\%\) of the cost of an adult ticket
Calculate the total cost of the five tickets
The plane leaves Miami at 09.29
It arrives in Mexico City 2 hours 11 minutes later
The local time in Miami is 1 hour ahead of the local time in Mexico City
Work out the time in Mexico City when the plane arrives
The family travels 38 kilometres by taxi
The journey costs \$3.50 plus an extra \$2.15 for each kilometre travelled
Find the cost of the journey
At the end of the holiday Mr Baker changes 1335 pesos into dollars
The exchange rate is \$1 = 17.8 pesos
Find how many dollars Mr Baker receives
Mr and Mrs Baker go on holiday with their three children
They fly from Miami to Mexico City
Shape \(A\) is a special type of quadrilateral
Write down the mathematical name for shape \(A\)
shape \(A\) onto shape \(B\),
shape \(A\) onto shape \(C\)
Describe fully the single transformation that maps
translate shape \(A\) by the vector \(\begin{pmatrix} 8 \\ -4 \end{pmatrix}\) ,
reflect shape \(A\) in the line \(x = 2\)
On the grid,
Find the area of shape \(B\)
Shapes \(A, B\) and \(C\) are shown on the \(1 \mathrm{cm}^2\) grid
Work out the actual distance between town \(A\) and town \(B\)
Town \(D\) is \(96\mathrm{km}\) from town \(C\) on a bearing of \(100^{\circ}\)
Scale : 1 cm to 10km
The scale drawing shows the positions of three towns \(A, B\) and \(C\) on a map
The scale is 1 centimetre represents 10 kilometres
The diagram shows the first three patterns in a sequence
Pattern 1
Pattern 2
Pattern 3
Pattern 4
On the grid, draw pattern 4
Write down the next two terms
Write down the rule for continuing this sequence
These are the first four terms of another sequence
Write down an expression for the \(n\)th term
Is 129 a term in this sequence?
Show how you decide
These are the first four terms of a different sequence
Bananas cost \$1.24 per kilogram
Stef pays with a \$5 note
Work out how much change she receives
Write 3.5 kilograms in grams
Stef buys 3.5 kilograms of bananas
Oranges cost 85 cents each
Leo has a \$10 note
Work out the maximum number of oranges he can buy
87% of the mass of a pineapple is water
A pineapple has a mass of 700 g
Work out the mass of water in this pineapple
The number of melons sold in a shop each day for 7 days is shown below
Work out the mean number of melons sold
Rio and Chi go to a fruit shop
Rio buys 4 apples and 2 plums for \$1.96
Chi buys 7 apples and 3 plums for \$3.24
Write down a pair of simultaneous equations and solve them to find the cost of 1 apple and the cost of 1 plum
You must show all your working
Write the number 602 047 in words
Find
(i) a multiple of 14,
Find the lowest common multiple (LCM) of 12 and 78
Find the highest common factor (HCF) of 12 and 78
Write 432 as a product of its prime factors
Complete the table of values for \(\begin{array}{r}y = \frac{6}{x}. \end{array}\)
On the grid, draw the graph of \(\begin{array}{r}y = \frac{6}{x} \end{array}\) for \(-6 \leqslant x \leqslant -1\) and \(1 \leqslant x \leqslant 6\)
Use your graph to solve the equation \(\frac{6}{x} = 4.5\)
On the grid, draw the line \(\begin{array}{r}y = x. \end{array}\)
Write down the co-ordinates of the points of intersection of \(\begin{array}{r}y = \frac{6}{x} \end{array}\) and \(\begin{array}{r}y = x. \end{array}\)
white,
blue,
not pink
A bag contains 20 bulbs
8 are yellow, 5 are red, 4 are white and 3 are pink
Sam takes one bulb at random
Find the probability that the bulb he takes is

Calculate the length of the fence
Sam has a rectangular pond, \(ABCD\)

The scale is 1 centimetre represents 4 metres

less than 30 metres from \(P\)
and
nearer to \(PQ\) than to \(PS\)
